channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: It’s been 20 years since the launch of Mac OS X
item.description: It’s macOS 11 now, but the DNA is the same.

item.title: Facebook shuts down hackers who infected iOS and Android devices
item.description: Social media platform used to spread malware that spied on Uyghurs.

item.title: Former Trump vaccine czar fired over substantiated sexual harassment claim
item.description: GSK hired a law firm for an investigation, which substantiated the claims.

item.title: Having it all: Protecting biodiversity, carbon capture, and fish stocks
item.description: Researchers scan the world’s oceans to find ideal locations for protection.

item.title: Slack pledges update to “Connect DM” after realizing harassment exists
item.description: Users immediately spotted the gaping loophole the company didn’t notice.

item.title: Event Horizon Telescope captures new view of black hole in polarized light
item.description: It should yield insight into how black holes gobble up matter and emit powerful jets.

item.title: Global chip shortage worsens, forces production cuts at GM, Hyundai
item.description: And a fire at a Renesas factory in Japan just made it even worse.

item.title: Apple updates Pages, Numbers, and Keynote to 11.0
item.description: Macs get a new media browser, and iPhones get interface improvements.

item.title: Qualcomm is reportedly building a Nintendo Switch clone, powered by Android
item.description: It has Joy-Con-style controllers and TV-out, reportedly targeting Q1 2022.

item.title: Musk: Tesla accepts bitcoin as payment, won’t convert it “to fiat currency”
item.description: Bitcoin option live on Tesla’s site in US now, coming to other countries later.

item.title: GameStop (the stock) and GameStop (the retailer) continue to be worlds apart
item.description: Valuation has dipped a bit but is still up roughly 900% in 3 months.

item.title: Ousted CEO Matze sues Parler, claims board robbed him of millions
item.description: The suit provides a peek into Parler’s founding and behind-the-scenes drama.

item.title: Intel CEO plans to build two new CPU fabs in Arizona
item.description: Analysts who predicted an Intel manufacturing spin-off got it badly wrong.

item.title: Fab fires and drought threaten to make chip shortages worse
item.description: Back-to-back incidents threaten to further strain already tight chip supplies.

item.title: TSMC: How a Taiwanese chipmaker became a linchpin of the global economy
item.description: At a time of shortages and competition, the company is dominant in chip production.

item.title: Relativity Space printed its Terran 1 rocket’s second stage in a few weeks
item.description: “We’re 75 percent of the way through printing the rocket’s first stage.”

item.title: Free software advocates seek removal of Richard Stallman and entire FSF board
item.description: Open letter signed by hundreds: RMS “has no place” in free software community.

item.title: HBO drops full trailer for new sci-fi period drama The Nevers
item.description: HBO’s new series will air in two parts due to a pandemic-related production hiatus.

item.title: Ransomware operators are piling on already hacked Exchange servers
item.description: The fallout from the Microsoft Exchange server crisis isn’t abating just yet.

item.title: NASA lays out plans for its first flights on Mars
item.description: The expectation is that we’ll have five flights over the course of a month.

item.title: Authorities raise red flags about AstraZeneca’s vaccine press release [Updated]
item.description: The “unforced error” in data reporting may raise more doubts about the vaccine.

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: Logitech mice and keyboards, gaming headsets, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has a buy 2, get 1 free sale at Amazon and wireless earbuds.

item.title: Valve releases Steam Link app on Apple’s Mac App Store
item.description: macOS release follows a Linux version just a few days ago.

item.title: Black Widow to Disney+: We finally know when, how much
item.description: Cruella dated for Disney+ as well, following “success” of March’s Raya.

item.title: FCC wants to hear from Americans who’ve been ignored by broadband industry
item.description: Consumer stories will help FCC as it inches toward geospatial broadband maps.

item.title: US pedestrian deaths rose sharply in the first half of 2020
item.description: When you account for the drop in miles traveled, deaths rose by 20 percent.

item.title: OnePlus snubs Google’s Wear OS, announces $159 smartwatch
item.description: Wear OS is so bad that OnePlus has cooked up a custom OS for its budget smartwatch.

item.title: Report: Microsoft in talks for $10 billion acquisition of Discord
item.description: Gaming-focused chat service has 140 million users across 6.7 million servers.

item.title: Firefox 87 is out today, adds Smart Block for improved private browsing
item.description: An improved referrer policy also trims URLs from embedded images and scripts.

item.title: Dark web bursting with COVID-19 vaccines, vaccine passports
item.description: Researchers saw listings increase 300% in the last three months.

item.title: OnePlus 9 Pro Review—Keeping the slightest lead in front of Samsung
item.description: OnePlus' $969 price is only $30 cheaper than a Galaxy S21 Plus.

item.title: Review: Why Zelda fans should seriously consider Monster Hunter Rise on Switch
item.description: Transformative controls, mostly steady 30 fps combat make this a must-own on Switch.

item.title: Unpaid environmental damages from fossil fuels are a $600B annual subsidy
item.description: Consumers get most of the benefits of unpaid costs, but companies get a slice, too.

item.title: The secret to a successful wine pairing? Fats have an affinity for tannins
item.description: Tannins interact at molecular level with fat globules in cheeses, meats, and oils.

item.title: Report: The next Nintendo Switch will deliver 4K on TVs via Nvidia’s DLSS
item.description: Also claims a jump in general specs—but how exactly will DLSS’s wizardry be toggled?

item.title: Judge grants class-action status to MacBook butterfly-keyboard suit
item.description: Apple phased out the design after 2019, but older models still have issues.

item.title: YouTuber Patrick (H) Willems has thoughts on movies—lots of thoughts
item.description: In this edition of “Personal History,” we talk with Willems about his YouTube comments.

item.title: Richard Stallman returns to FSF 18 months after controversial rape comments
item.description: Stallman quit in 2019 after emails about Jeffrey Epstein and age-of-consent laws.

item.title: AstraZeneca vaccine: 79% effective and no rare blood clots in US trial
item.description: The trial results seem positive, but the vaccine may continue to raise doubts.

item.title: Hardcore F1 fans might feel short-changed by Drive to Survive season 3
item.description: The documentary gives short shrift to some of the biggest stories from 2020.

item.title: Jury orders Apple to pay $308 million in royalties for DRM patent
item.description: FairPlay DRM used in iTunes and Apple Music infringed on small company’s patent.

item.title: Europe is starting to freak out about the launch dominance of SpaceX
item.description: The Falcon 9 has come to dominate commercial satellite launches.

item.title: Super Seducer 3 ban highlights Steam’s fuzzy “adult content” rules
item.description: “Sexually explicit images of real people” not allowed on the service, Valve says.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S21 US sales have reportedly tripled compared to last year
item.description: The Galaxy S21 line is $200 cheaper this year, and Samsung is seeing results.

item.title: Stabbing, crucifixion, eaten by eels: Learn all about murder the Roman way
item.description: Emma Southon discusses her new book, A Fatal Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum.

item.title: New York lawmaker wants to ban police use of armed robots
item.description: Use of Boston Robotics' Digidog intensifies concerns about police militarization.

item.title: Mouse embryos grow for days in culture, but the requirements are a bit nuts
item.description: And human embryos now get to the earliest state of development in a dish.

item.title: Facebook finally explains its mysterious new wrist wearable
item.description: Will we be able to trust it with a new form of personal data? (Probably not.)

item.title: Apple bent its rules for Russia—and other countries will take note
item.description: Russian iPhone buyers soon to see prompts to install software developed in Russia.

item.title: Hackers are exploiting a server vulnerability with a severity of 9.8 out of 10
item.description: As if the mass-exploitation of Exchange servers wasn’t enough, now there’s BIG-IP.
